title: Serifs halfpriced - SAX 5266 cover-font
content:
hi all!

this font obviously has seen a '70s baisse foreclosure! half its serifs got chopped!

the handling of serifs in this font is …special - YOUR expert eye might recognize the font immediately where  
wtf couldn't do the job; i tried identifonts "tools" as well (specialty capital\_y has a lead) but it is not in its listing.

sorry: but haydn is just a 5 letter word! ;)

(as a one off: has anyone ever seen a non-italic bodoni with such an open small\_g? accent aigu perhaps interesting too)

thanks !!

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317200156im_/http:/typophile.com/files/2222_5872.jpg)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317200156im_/http:/typophile.com/files/3333_5085.JPG)

Font: 

 Carolus 

Solved By: 

 [DPape](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317200156/http:/typophile.com/user/3945 "View user profile.")

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [2222.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317200156/http:/typophile.com/files/2222.jpg) | 33.84 KB |
author: cartouche

comments.content:
Try:  
 [http://www.dafont.com/carolus-roman.font?text=HAYDN](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317200156/http:/www.dafont.com/carolus-roman.font?text=HAYDN)  
 [![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317200156im_/http:/i.imgur.com/oz4UZSh.jpg " imgur.com")](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317200156/http:/imgur.com/oz4UZSh)

How about: AW Conqueror Didot Light  
 [http://typofonderie.com/fonts/aw-conqueror-family/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317200156/http:/typofonderie.com/fonts/aw-conqueror-family/)  
 [![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317200156im_/http:/i.imgur.com/gcWZzFS.jpg " imgur.com")](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317200156/http:/imgur.com/gcWZzFS)

Looking through Typophile’s archives, I learnt that the original designer of Carolus is Karl-Erik Forsberg ( [http://www.linotype.com/710/karlerikforsberg.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317200156/http:/www.linotype.com/710/karlerikforsberg.html "http://www.linotype.com/710/karlerikforsberg.html")) and that there was a digital version of the same name by Image Club, also published by Corel as Carleton.

excellent! that's of great help!

since dpape pointed to a digitised font which essentially has the same name as the original i guess its ok to award him the title :)  
special thanks to riccard0 (again) for very valuable info - dafonts version is a little oddly digitised?! - with your help i found a better suiting digitisation!

i'll keep it open for a bit longer though because i'd like to see if there's some more coming up in regards of the 2nd font;  
i have read a thread on differences between bodoni and didot; dpape very cleverly came up with a didot - but although small\_a has a didot-belly, small\_t (both not pictured) has a bodoni-antenna and serifs are tapered bodoni-style…
Dafonts is never the first choice, but always a safe choice...
